ns2:goal.ns2:name: Supported Handsets
ns2:goal.ns2:text: The following handsets will be supported: Snapper V-8, Slider Sonic, Switchback, Slice, Cyclops, Wild Card, Super Slice, Slash, Messaging 08, Slice Repl 08, Moto Jefferson 08.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: Streaming Audio and Video product
ns2:goal.ns2:text: Nellymoser will design and develop a Streaming Audio and Video product for Virgin Mobile USA’s first EVDO device. For EVDO devices, there is no need to support a Java client.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: Designed by Nellymoser and approved by VMU
ns2:goal.ns2:text: The EVDO Streaming Video product will be a new VMU-branded service designed by Nellymoser and approved by VMU.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: Accessing the service
ns2:goal.ns2:text: Users will access the Streaming Video service via a link from the Virgin XL WAP environment.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: Types of Content
ns2:goal.ns2:text: Nellymoser will provide the branded and white-label short form video clip content including weather, news, sports, action, movie previews and entertainment. The full content lineup is detailed in the Nellymoser presentation: Nellymoser Sourced Content (2 2608).FINAL.ppt.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: product name
ns2:goal.ns2:text: The EVDO Streaming Video product name is: TBD.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: Style Guidelines
ns2:goal.ns2:text: The EVDO Streaming Video page templates and branding should reflect: VMU WAP Style Guide (w/ source files) and VMU Style Guide.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: Organization of Content
ns2:goal.ns2:text: The EVDO Streaming Video Main Menu should contain: Featured Content, VMU Channels: Life & Hot Shots, Catalog Browse, Top Rated Content in the Community, Top Viewed Content in the Community (in the past 7 days), and VMU-branded content channels that include the Nellymoser Sourced Content.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: Flow through the application
ns2:goal.ns2:text: The EVDO Streaming Video Main Menu user flow is: Main Menu -> Content Folder or Browse Results Page -> Video Clip Details Page -> Purchase Confirmation (If applicable) -> Stream -> Video Clip Return Page -> Originating Content Folder or Browse Results Page.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: EVDO device support
ns2:goal.ns2:text: Nellymoser will design and develop a Streaming Audio and Video product for Virgin Mobile USA's first EVDO device. For EVDO devices, there is no need to support a Java client.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: Video Clip Details Page
ns2:goal.ns2:text: The Video Clip Details Page will include user Poll Results, Community Rating and User Comments. Community rating should be displayed in half-star increments. (For example, if average rating is 2.5 stars, then 2.5 stars should be displayed rather than 2 or 3 stars).

ns2:goal.ns2:name: Video Clip Return Page
ns2:goal.ns2:text: The Video Clip Return Page will allow the user to rate the content, answer a poll question and enter a comment.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: New Content must be distinguished
ns2:goal.ns2:text: "New" Content must be distinguished from "archive" content with a tag or other visual marker.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: Free video gallery
ns2:goal.ns2:text: A Free video gallery should be made available for users to preview the EVDO Streaming Video product.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: "head to head" matchups
ns2:goal.ns2:text: The EVDO Video Product must support "head to head" matchups that allow users to vote between two pieces of content.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: Send to a friend
ns2:goal.ns2:text: The EVDO Video Product must allow the user to refer content to a friend via SMS.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: search for keywords
ns2:goal.ns2:text: The EVDO Video Product must be capable of launching a mobile web search for keywords within the Content metadata.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: new content notification
ns2:goal.ns2:text: The EVDO Video Product must have short code integration so that users can be notified of new content.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: user favorites
ns2:goal.ns2:text: The EVDO Video Product must allow the user to tag content for inclusion in a "My Content" folder.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: About, FAQ and User Guide
ns2:goal.ns2:text: The EVDO Video Product must contain About, FAQ and User Guide pages.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: publish XML feeds of video content
ns2:goal.ns2:text: The EVDO Video Product must be able to publish XML feeds to VMU which allow video content to be published in other areas of the VXL portal.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: support Sugarmama
ns2:goal.ns2:text: The EVDO Video Product must support Sugarmama, VMU’s mobile advertising program. (Nice to Have).

ns2:goal.ns2:name: content refreshed weekly
ns2:goal.ns2:text: The EVDO Video Product content library must be refreshed weekly. Nellymoser will manage the batch upload of all Streaming Video content.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: Content Management Interface
ns2:goal.ns2:text: The Content Management Interface is the publishing tool that allows VMU to control the application content.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: CMI URL
ns2:goal.ns2:text: The existing CMI URL is: TBD.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: CMI requires a user name and a password
ns2:goal.ns2:text: Entering the CMI requires a user name and a password.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: Merchandising changes
ns2:goal.ns2:text: Merchandising changes made to Headliner Streaming Audio content for the Phase I Java client should also be applied in the Phase III Headliner Jukebox Storefront on WAP.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: CMI features
ns2:goal.ns2:text: For Streaming Video content, the CMI allows the VMU content manager to browse, remove, classify and edit metadata to Streaming Video clips with functionality similar to that offered for Streaming Audio tracks.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: CMI upload content with metadata
ns2:goal.ns2:text: The CMI allows the content manager to upload individual pieces of Streaming Video content with metadata.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: name and order the folders and channels
ns2:goal.ns2:text: The CMI allows the content manager to name and order the Streaming Video folders and channels.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: remove and modify VMU items
ns2:goal.ns2:text: The CMI allows the content manager to remove and modify VMU items.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: publish the content
ns2:goal.ns2:text: Once all updated content items are ready, the content manager can publish the content into the production service.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: Billing & Reconciliation reports
ns2:goal.ns2:text: Vendor will provide VMU the Billing & Reconciliation reports below (capable of being opened and manipulated in Excel) allowing: Billing Reconciliation between VMU Billing Server and Vendor charge transactions for Vendor invoices, Remuneration of Content providers for purchased content, and Tracing Billing System return code for each transaction.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: Report 1
ns2:goal.ns2:text: Report #1: The data collected during each Charge transaction will be captured in real time and accumulated in a transaction log. The log file will not be available for any processing until the end of each day.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: daily transaction log
ns2:goal.ns2:text: One transaction log file will be created daily (and made available to VMU on an ad hoc basis if necessary). The format for the name of this log file is: transaction.log.<YYYY-MM-DD>.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: transaction log is a standard UNIX file
ns2:goal.ns2:text: The transaction log is a standard UNIX file.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: log file field delimiter
ns2:goal.ns2:text: The field delimiter within the file is the <TAB> character.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: log file ordered by transaction date
ns2:goal.ns2:text: The data in the file will be ordered by transaction date (first field).

ns2:goal.ns2:name: log file aggregation
ns2:goal.ns2:text: Each month, all of the individual daily transaction log files will be grouped into a compressed file then stored in a dedicated folder. The format for the name of this compressed file is: transaction.<YYYY-MM-DD>_<YYYY-MM-DD>.tar.gz, where the dates are the first and the last date of the given period

ns2:goal.ns2:name: maintain 12 months worth of log data
ns2:goal.ns2:text: The last 12 months worth of data (i.e., the 12 most recent tar.gz files) will be preserved for download through a Web server. The format for the name of this compressed file the same as above.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: record format
ns2:goal.ns2:text: The record format is fully defined in a table in the following section of this document.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: Reports #2 & 3
ns2:goal.ns2:text: Reports #2 & 3: The transaction data collected for Report #1 will be aggregated monthly (on Monday, containing data for the preceding month) for the purposes of content provider reconciliation and renumeration.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: Logs preserved for 12 months
ns2:goal.ns2:text: The last 12 months worth of data (i.e., the 12 most recent tgz files) will be preserved on a RAID disk device and available for download through a Web server.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: Report formats
ns2:goal.ns2:text: Report formats are fully defined below in tables X.X and X.X.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: Media playback
ns2:goal.ns2:text: Media playback should not begin unless the user has been authenticated and charged.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: Media playback starts after charging
ns2:goal.ns2:text: At the conclusion of Streaming Video Charging, video playback begins.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: Monthly Data Plan
initiation of streaming video session
ns2:goal.ns2:text: At initiation of streaming video session, the WAP browser will communicate Network Type, video location URL and invoke the handset’s media player.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: streaming bit rate
ns2:goal.ns2:text: Vendor determines appropriate streaming bit rate based upon Network Type.

ns2:goal.ns2:name: changes in Network Type
ns2:goal.ns2:text: During stream, Vendor must be able to adjust streaming bit rate based on changes in Network Type.
